ReviewList.Text: Great book, very clear and concise. If you have trouble understanding the physics itself, try reading "Conceptual Physics" by Paul G. Hewitt. It's by far the best physics textbook out there, and I used it to supplement my college physics class if I didn't understand a concept from this textbook or lecture.

My expectations were met. I was a first time Amazon user and I was a little apprehensive about making a purchase online, but I'm glad I did it, I saved a lot of money...the school's bookstore was asking for 5 times what I paid!!!

It has some good practice problems but I haven't found it that helpful in getting me to understand the subject more, but I think that is because my teacher is so good and I don't need to rely on the book.
The book has a way of helping the reader plan how to solve and study, which is quite useful. The order makes perfect sense, and the concepts flow into one another to ease understanding.
purchased for a class.  Very clearly written.  Small print.  I need to use my largest magnifiers 1.75.  Shipped quickly with internet access.  Great value.  TY.
The rental period is shorter than the semester, I have to extend rental time. I’m going to try Barns and Noble from now on.
All the information I needed to study for my tests. Very Useful and easy to understand, though the price is a little high.
This is nice book. This book helps a lot. Most problems are easy to understand. Nice book that's all I can say.

Seller listed this book in very good condition when it arrived it was in good condition at best.  The cover was worn and coming apart at the corners.  The corners were bend and a few pages were folded.  I am concerned this seller doesn't know the meaning of something in very good condition.  I purchased this book and paid slightly more to receive a very good condition book and boy was I disappointed, so buyer be aware you might not get what you expected as far as quality.
They sent the wrong book and when notified have done nothing to rectify the situation. But at your own risk.
My son told me it was in lousy condition; however, he was able to read it and study for his physics course.
